title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1. DEMAND FOR Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: By end 2021 the population in targeted zones, particularly women, schoolchildren and health facilities, and especially the most vulnerable, have the knowledge and motivation to use good hygiene and sanitation practices, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Hygiene, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: By the end of 2022, women and children in the 11 target regions, especially the most vulnerable, make greater and sustainable use of safe drinking water and sanitation services and adopt good hygiene practices to prevent diseases.

description.narrative: CLTS activities enabled;639,641;people to live in ODF villages, and;14;additional cantons were certified ODF in 2021, i.e. 112%;of the annual target, and;the overall target for the;programme;cycle;was;at 104%.; The promotion of good hygiene practices reached 667 schools,against a target of 862(77% of annual achievement), among those, 301 schools were supported with MHM and;6,206 girls were given;MHM;kits to improve their school attendance.;;The involvement of mothers’;Associations;and teachers (including;men);in MHM activities;improved;adolescent girls’;education and made the school environment more supportive;of;them. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:23/01/2022
